questions.question_text: An IT administrator deployed an OEAP to the home of a remote user, but the OEAP cannot reach the WLC. Which two configuration settings must be completed before an OEAP is deployed successfully? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Configure Secondary Controller Name and Management IP address in the High Availability tab.
choices.D: Configure the WLC with an external IP address on the virtual interface.
choices.B: Configure LSC to authorize the OEAP.
choices.C: Configure the AP mode to FlexConnect and check the box for Office Extend AP.
choices.E: Configure Primary Controller Name and Management IP address in the High Availability tab.

discussion.content:
A. don't forget that the WLC is located at the campus site, thus it would have a trunk link to the LAN with all vlans.
Answers B,C and D wouldn't make sens for users at the campus since the APs are in local mode and not flexconnect. so the only valid option that i would go for is A.
Another dumb Cisco question that contradicts itself. No wonder people are either cheating or giving up with this crap.

Selected Answer: A
correct is A , C not correct , in the question it was defined that the APs on Campus are in local mode .

comments.content:
You are right, the APs are in local mode but put attention to the question. "Which configuration must be applied to the APs for corporate devices on the main campus to be mapped to the local LAN switch on different VLANs according to the
VLAN tag ID and WLAN?"

"mapped to the local LAN switch"
C is correct

questions.question_text:
An IT administrator deploys Cisco 2802i APs in all office locations, including main campus and branch offices. The WLC that manages the APs is located at the data center on the main campus. The APs on the main campus are configured to use Local mode and the APs in the branches use FlexConnect mode. Which configuration must be applied to the APs for corporate devices on the main campus to be mapped to the local LAN switch on different VLANs according to the
VLAN tag ID and WLAN?

An engineer is in the process of implementing Fastiane on a wireless network with a Mobility Express AP installed and Apple end-user devices. Due to a security concern, the IT department has updated all the iPads to version 14.5.423551943. Which QoS profile must the engineer configure on the user WLAN?

discussion.content:
D. Do not set any master APs.

In a FlexConnect group, when you do not set any master APs, the controller dynamically selects one AP as the master AP based on the lowest MAC address for each model in the group. This ensures that each model with the lowest MAC address gets its upgrade directly from the controller.

So, the correct action is to not set any master APs (Option D) for the FlexConnect group.

Selected Answer: D
D. seems to do exactly what the question wants. By default the AP for each model with the lowest mac with do the download. No need to set it manually.

Selected Answer: D
It specifically says that it wants the default of the lowest MAC, so you do not set a Master as this would over-ride the default. Answer is D.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D
A FlexConnect group can have one primary AP per AP model. If a primary AP is not selected manually, the AP that has the least MAC address value is automatically chosen as the primary AP for that model.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-6/config-guide/b_cg86/configuring_flexconnect_ap_upgrades_for_flexconnect_aps.html#:~:text=A%20FlexConnect%20group%20can%20have%20one%20primary%20AP%20per%20AP%20model.%20If%20a%20primary%20AP%20is%20not%20selected%20manually%2C%20the%20AP%20that%20has%20the%20least%20MAC%20address%20value%20is%20automatically%20chosen%20as%20the%20primary%20AP%20for%20that%20model.

Selected Answer: C
agree with Yod_Jjot C is correct
according to question One AP of each model with the lowest MAC address in the group must receive the upgrade.
here is not mentioned that there is any specific configuration. we have to assume configuration for group is default . If a primary AP is not selected manually,
the AP that has the least MAC address value is automatically chosen as the primary AP for that model. By allocating the master APs to different groups we will accomplish the request.

C is the correct answer.
Ref: https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/controller/8-6/config-guide/b_cg86/configuring_flexconnect_ap_upgrades_for_flexconnect_aps.pdf

See the "Configuring FlexConnect AP Upgrades (GUI)" section.
Step 6 From the AP Name drop-down list, click Add Master to add the primary access point.
You can manually assign primary access points in the FlexConnect group by selecting the access points.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D as the default AP the image will be downloaded to is the one with the lowest MAC

questions.question_text: An engineer wants to upgrade the APs in a Cisco FlexConnect group. To accomplish this upgrade, the FlexConnect AP Upgrade setting will be used. One AP of each model with the lowest MAC address in the group must receive the upgrade directly from the controller. Which action accomplishes this direct upgrade?

choices.D: Do not set any master APs.
choices.C: Allocate the master APs to different groups.
choices.A: Remove the APs from the group.
choices.B: Reboot all APs before the upgrade.

choices.C: config subscription notification interval rssi rogues 5
choices.B: config nmsp notification interval rssi rogues 5
choices.D: config cmx notification interval rssi rogues 5
choices.A: config location notification interval rssi rogues 5
